results.title: Applying a Therblig check list
results.brief_description: Illustrates how a Therblig checklist can be applied to jobs for the purpose of developing an improved method. The program demonstrates several jobs being performed and then applies the appropriate check list question for the purpose of devising an improved method.

results.title: Apples from your garden
results.brief_description: Instructional film for gardeners on apple growing from cordons and bush trees; describes grafting, budding, choice of root stock to suit different types of soil, digging of soil and the planting of cordons and bush trees. No other credits available.

results.title: Apple aphis
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses briefly five of the most destructive of the family Aphididae which attack apple trees and fully illustrates the life-cycle of one of them, the green apple aphis. Using micro-photography techniques the various stages in the life-cycle are shown - from the emergence of the nymph from the egg through to mating and reproduction. A final diagrammatical section summarizes the life-cycle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit

A final diagrammatical section summarizes the life-cycle.

results.title: Appetite of a bird
results.brief_description: An animated conflict between man and a woman - the both being handformed from shape to shape. An interesting interpretation of male and female roles.

results.title: Apollo soyuz
results.creator_credit: Byron Morgan, David Gerber and Screen Presentation
results.brief_description: Describes the agreements and preparation for the 1975 Apollo Soyuz international space mission. The United States and the USSR May 1972 agreement for this joint mission in space includes standardization of docking procedures and equipment that will increase safety, provides for dual rescue missions, and opens up new opportunities for further research and discoveries. Narrated by Yul Brynner and Paul Picerni.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Byron Morgan, David Gerber and Screen Presentation

results.title: Apollo 12: pinpoint for science
results.brief_description: The story of the flight of Apollo 12 and the second landing of men on the moon on November 19th 1969. Gives primary emphasis to the lunar exploration carried out by the crew; deployment of scientific equipment, retrieval of parts of a Surveyor space craft which landed on the moon in 1967, and the collection of rock and soil samples. No other credits available

results.title: Apollo 11: one giant leap for mankind
results.brief_description: Follows the flight of Apollo 11 to the Moon and back, showing the launching and each stage of the operation with views and comments of the astronauts, their activities on the surface and return trip to President Nixon’s welcome No other credits available

results.title: Apollo 10: prelude to the moon landing
results.brief_description: Depicts the “dress rehearsal” of the Apollo 11 flight with astronauts Stafford, Young and Cernan. This mission supplied information to assist the Apollo 11 moon landing and the film contains the first colour television shot in space and shows the spacecraft nine miles from the lunar surface.
